intro: Pyrola macrocalyx, commonly known as the large-flowered wintergreen, is a perennial herb native to the forests of eastern North America. It belongs to the Ericaceae family, which includes many shrubs and plants adapted to acidic soils. The plant produces showy, bell-shaped white or pink flowers that bloom in late winter or early spring. Its leaves are evergreen, leathery, and have a distinctive waxy coating. Pyrola macrocalyx thrives in shaded, moist environments and is often found in association with other woodland flora.
